When Arup is already engaged on a project and via this existing connection / commission, an introduction is provided to another service, discipline or practice to secure a role on the same project
Arup, be it independently or in collaboration with other individual(s) or firm(s), identifies a gap / opportunity to suggest a “project”, develops the idea and then proposes to a client
When Arup’s option to tender for a project is as a direct result of a previous shortlisting via a panel, prequalification, framework or the like.

The client of another Arup team (AT1) possibly has current or pending work for them, but regardless, are definitely looking for something offered by another Arup team (AT2). AT1 suggests / cross sells AT2 to said client and provides introduction or referr
When only Arup invited to put forward a proposal / offer for a project role, without any competition at all.

When Arup is invited to respond as one of X total number of competitors. Common with government departments where procedure dictates a minimum number of responses to ensure competitiveness and value for money. E.g. Project value >$100k must have at least

When the tender submission is the final hurdle in deliberate pursuit of a project role where prior to the release of tender documents we have undertaken client relationship building activities, demonstrated our capability and experience, etc. in order to
When the release of a tender is via various media (e.g. government, tender website, newspaper, etc.) which is open to an offer by any company or individual who decide to respond.

entity.MobileOfflineFilters: <fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"> <entity name="opportunity"> <filter type="and"> <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="last-x-days" value="10"/> </filter> </entity> </fetch>

Strings.String: An opportunity can be associated with only one organisation.

You cannot set up duplicate relationships between an opportunity and a customer. For example, if you create a relationship between an opportunity and the organisation Fabrikam, Inc., and the customer's relationship role is set to Distributor, you cannot create a new relationship for the opportunity that uses the same customer and relationship role.
Locate a prospect or potential sales opportunity. Convert qualified leads into organisations, contacts, and opportunities.
This customer will be either the organisation or contact associated with this opportunity. The Potential Customer column appears in the Opportunities list in the Sales pane.
Manage the standard labels users can apply when they define relationship roles between organisations, contacts, and opportunities.

Work with leads, opportunities, organisations, contacts, and lists. Maintain information about competitors and manage sales literature. Create quotes and convert them to orders and invoices. Create and view quick campaigns.
Deleting the {0} will delete all records under the {0} as well (for example, opportunities, activities, and contacts). Sub-organisations will be removed from the organisation, but not deleted.
You have chosen to reopen a closed opportunity. To continue, click OK.
